intro: Pogonopus speciosus var. sandwithianus, commonly known as the Sandwich Island pogonopus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal or lowland areas. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a distinctive white or purplish vein pattern. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
